items.title: Yilmaz biedt excuses aan na tirade tegen arbiter: 'Moet kalmer worden'
items.summary: Burak Yilmaz is nog altijd een heethoofd. Dinsdag verloor de trainer van het Turkse Gaziantep zijn zelfbeheersing in de bekerwedstrijd tegen Kocaelispor. De scheidsrechter van dienst was het leidende voorwerp in zijn tirade, waar hij later zijn excuses voor aanbood.

items.title: ‚ÄòOne of the world‚Äôs best‚Äô: Manchester City sign USWNT midfielder Sam Coffey
items.summary: USA mainstay in move from Portland Thorns ‚ÄòI couldn‚Äôt be more ready and happy about everything‚Äô Manchester City have signed the USA midfielder Sam Coffey on a three-and-a-half year deal. The 27-year-old won gold at the Paris 2024 Olympics and has accrued 42 caps and scored five goals for the USA, becoming a key part of Emma Hayes‚Äô national team. After graduating she joined Portland Thorns and lifted the 2022 NWSL Championship in her debut season. Continue reading...

items.title: Morgan Rogers, kroonjuweel van Aston Villa
items.summary: Met 43 punten uit 21 wedstrijden stevent Aston Villa af op het verbreken van zijn clubrecord in de Premier League. Arsenal en Manchester City zijn in de titelstrijd nog niet verlost van de ploeg van trainer Unai Emery. E√©n speler in het bijzonder valt op bij The Villans: Morgan Rogers (23).

items.title: Opmerkelijk bekeravondje voor Icardi ondanks zege Galatasaray
items.summary: Galatasaray heeft dinsdagavond een bekerzege geboekt op Fethiyespor, maar voor spits Mauro Icardi was het geen prettige avond op bezoek bij de nummer veertien uit de 2. Liga.

items.title: Police on ban of Maccabi fans: AI was to blame
items.summary: West Midlands Police's chief constable has apologised to MPs for giving them an error in evidence over the decision to ban Maccabi Tel Aviv fans.

items.title: Erik ten Hag komt met gevoel en vooral ambitie thuis: 'Ik leef mijn eigen leven'
items.summary: Vol trots presenteerde FC Twente woensdagochtend Erik ten Hag als nieuwe technisch directeur. Het zorgde voor een vleugje romantiek over het verleden, maar vooral voor een ambitieuze blik naar de toekomst. En met een intrigerende wending: ‚ÄòAls Erik bondscoach zou willen worden, gaan we kijken hoe we dat mogelijk kunnen maken.‚Äô

items.title: Delay in disallowed Semenyo goal an 'edge case'
items.summary: The delay in ruling out a Manchester City goal for offside in Tuesday's Carabao Cup win at Newcastle was extended because semi-automated offside technology could not be used in the incident.

items.title: Man City sign USWNT's Coffey from Thorns
items.summary: Manchester City have announced the signing of United States midfielder Sam Coffey from NWSL side Portland Thorns.

items.title: Barcelona's Flick: Alonso has great future ahead
items.summary: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said Xabi Alonso will land a new job quickly, backing the outgoing Real Madrid coach to have a great career in management.

items.title: Malen zegt 'ja' tegen AS Roma, mogelijk debuut tegen Torino
items.summary: De transfer van Donyell Malen naar AS Roma nadert zijn voltooiing. Na het akkoord met Aston Villa hebben de Italianen ook groen licht gekregen van de 26-jarige aanvaller. Het wachten is nog op de medische keuring.

items.title: The Coupe de France was short of magic ‚Äì and then Paris FC beat PSG
items.summary: In a weekend where most favourites triumphed, Paris FC beating the holders was a welcome win for the underdogs By Get French Football News This year‚Äôs Coupe de France was in need of a spark and Paris FC were on hand to provide it. Their league match against Paris Saint-Germain last weekend ‚Äì the first derby between the clubs in 43 years ‚Äì was somewhat anticlimactic. The rivalry between is tepid, bordering on amicable, and the difference in quality was stark as PSG ran out fairly comfortable 2-1 winners. St√©phane Gilli‚Äôs men are a long way off challenging the reigning European champions over a full season but, on Monday night, that was irrelevant. Paris FC returned to the Parc des Princes and won 1-0, progressing to the last 16 of the Coupe de France at their neighbour‚Äôs expense. It was a derby once again lacking in derby feel. Jonathan Ikon√© scored the winner but did not celebrate against the club from whose academy he graduated. Luis Enrique even wished Paris FC ‚Äúall the best for the rest of the competition‚Äù after the match ‚Äì all very cordial. The PSG manager was left ruing his side‚Äôs wastefulness as he succumbed to his first defeat in the competition since arriving in France in 2023. As far as the cup is concerned, though, PSG‚Äôs slip-up was a welcome one. Continue reading...

items.title: Premier League's top 50 transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
items.summary: What makes a great signing? Is it trophies won, goals scored, a long run of dominance ... or all of the above? Bill Connelly breaks down the best 50 Premier League moves since it began in 1992-93.

items.title: Spurs sporting director Paratici to join Fiorentina
items.summary: Tottenham's joint sporting director Fabio Paratici is to leave the club and join Fiorentina following the end of the January transfer window, three months after returning to the club.

items.title: Fleetwood determined to close the gap on McIlroy and Scheffler
items.summary: Dubai Invitational defending champion, Tommy Fleetwood, revealed what it is like to be next-best to two of the Tour's greatest players after a year of consistency paid off and he moved up the rankings to third.

items.title: Woods: Koepka's return to PGA Tour from LIV a 'win for everyone'
items.summary: Tiger Woods said Brooks Koepka's return to the PGA Tour makes it "a better place to play" and is a "win for everyone".

items.title: Rangers agree loan for Wolfsburg winger Skov Olsen
items.summary: Rangers have agreed a loan deal for Wolfsburg winger Andreas Skov Olsen.

items.title: 'We're really stretched' - Livramento blow adds to Newcastle defence concerns
items.summary: Head coach Eddie Howe admits Newcastle United are "really stretched" after Tino Livramento is ruled out for up to two months with a hamstring injury.

items.title: Pro Licence admission barriers allow women‚Äôs coaching opportunities to go ‚Äòdown the drain‚Äô
items.summary: Uefa‚Äôs limitations have set hurdles for women keen to take the next step in coaching despite the increasing demand Mariana Cabral has a coaching CV to be proud of. Born on the small Azores island of S√£o Miguel, she has been in charge of the women‚Äôs teams at clubs including Benfica and Sporting, but the 38-year-old is frustrated. ‚ÄúWe want more women coaches,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúWho won the Euros? Who won the Champions League? Women ‚Äì but we are losing so many.‚Äù Cabral has her A Licence but is stuck in limbo. Unable to get on a Pro Licence course that would clear a path to more senior head coach roles in an era when women‚Äôs teams are increasingly demanding that qualification, she stepped back to become a No 2 in the US. But after one NWSL season with Utah Royals, she left in December in the hope that expanding her experience at another club would help to open a Pro Licence door. Continue reading...
